bug.short_desc: [UX] dnf install tries to update the installed dependencies to newer version (at least message says that)

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
I'm not quite sure what is the problem here - dnf or problems in the particular packages but in some cases dnf skips packages which can be upgraded. See below for more info.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): dnf-1.1.0-2.fc24.noarch
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. On a rawhide-20150814 system without the latest upgrades I do the following 2. git clone https://github.com/atodorov/anaconda 3. cd anaconda/ 4. make -f Makefile.am install-buildrequires 5. make -f Makefile.am install-requires
Actual results:
I see the following errors:
# make -f Makefile.am install-buildrequires srcdir="" && \ : ${srcdir:=.} && \ pkglist="$(grep ^BuildRequires: ${srcdir}/anaconda.spec.in | cut -d ' ' -f 2)" && \ if ! [[ $(uname -m) =~ s390x? ]]; then \ pkglist=$(echo "$pkglist" | grep -v s390utils) ; \ fi ; \ dnf install $pkglist gettext-devel libtool Last metadata expiration check performed 2:10:58 ago on Wed Aug 19 04:55:08 2015. Package gettext-0.19.5.1-2.fc24.x86_64 is already installed, skipping. Package systemd-224-1.fc24.x86_64 is already installed, skipping. Package rpm-devel-4.12.90-7.fc24.x86_64 is already installed, skipping. Package desktop-file-utils-0.22-5.fc23.x86_64 is already installed, skipping. Package gsettings-desktop-schemas-3.16.1-2.fc23.x86_64 is already installed, skipping. Transaction Summary ============================================================================================================================================================================ Install 181 Packages Upgrade 1 Package
Total download size: 86 M Is this ok [y/N]: n Operation aborted. Makefile.am:127: recipe for target 'install-requires' failed make: *** [install-requires] Error 1
# rpm -q libreport-filesystem libselinux libselinux-devel libselinux-python3 libselinux-utils libreport-filesystem-2.6.2-2.fc24.x86_64 libselinux-2.4-1.fc24.1.x86_64 libselinux-devel-2.4-1.fc24.1.x86_64 libselinux-python3-2.4-1.fc24.1.x86_64 libselinux-utils-2.4-1.fc24.1.x86_64
Expected results:
Both desktop-file-utils and libselinux* packages are already installed on the system so I was expecting they will be upgraded in the same way glib2, glib2-devel, gtk3, pango, and libreport-filesystem are upgraded.
Additional info:

"dnf install foo" does not upgrade "foo". Where did you get the impression that it should? I didn't test it but I believe that in this case, glib2, glib2-devel, gtk3, pango, and libreport-filesystem were upgraded just because the other packages required a newer version of these packages.
Another issue is that "Skipping packages with conflicts:" section which shouldn't be printed in this case IMO.
The install command does install only. Lets track the second case where it tries to update the dependencies to newest version and could be confusing. The message should not be there.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.
I believe that the problem about problem reports will be fixed in https://github.com/rpm-software-management/dnf/pull/782. Hope that it helps.
